thread.title: Chelsea's Antonio Conte Hits Back At Jose Mourinho In Classy Fashion
thread.title_full: Chelsea's Antonio Conte Hits Back At Jose Mourinho In Classy Fashion

title: Chelsea's Antonio Conte Hits Back At Jose Mourinho In Classy Fashion
text:
Chelsea's Antonio Conte Hits Back At Jose Mourinho In Classy Fashion Sun Feb 12 2017 22:44:31   22:44:31   
C helsea manager Antonio Conte hit back at Jose Mourinho 's claims that his side are winning with a "very defensive" style today and firmly put the Portuguese manager in his place. 
Conte's Blues extended their lead at the top of the Premier League this afternoon ten points, albeit they were held to a 1-1 draw by a stubborn and hard-working Burnley side. 
Afterwards, the Italian coach was quizzed on Mourinho's comments, and speaking via the Mirror , he hit back in classy fashion by simply smiling before saying: 
"Yeah [I heard it], but I don't like to reply to other coaches. " 
Not only is Conte stopping himself from engaging in a tit-for-tat war of words which looks rather unsavoury, he is also shining a light on how childish Mourinho can be at times by taking pot-shots at other coaches. 
Earlier this season, Chelsea beat Manchester United 4-0 at Stamford Bridge and the two managers were involved in a heated row at full-time, with Mourinho accusing Conte of being unsporting. 
The two sides don't meet again until April 15 at Old Trafford but we're counting down the days already. 
The repsonse from Conte comes after Mourinho referred to them as a defensive team yesterday as United went within two points of second place with their win over Watford: 
"Chelsea are a very good defensive team. 
"They defend very well and with lots of players and I think in this situation a very defensive team wins the title with counter-attack goals and set pieces goals so I don't think they will let it slip but football is football." 
This story was first featured on talkingbaws.com - simple, shareable sport. Like them on Facebook and follow them on Twitter. Sponsored Links
